    description => string (3273) "<p id="0" class="story_para_0">Samsung has announced its 2022 line up of its...
    $value[65]['description']
    <p id="0" class="story_para_0">Samsung has announced its 2022 line up of its the company’s Curd Maestro and Digi Touch Cool range of refrigerators that come with an “India centric design."</p>
<p id="1" class="story_para_1">The Curd Maestro is the world’s first refrigerator that can make curd, and will now be available in a Bouquet Silver colour, which comes with a flower pattern design on steel finish and Mid Night Blossom. These refrigerators are aimed at addressing the pain points of daily curd making, and have been designed to revolutionise the conventional usage of a refrigerator. The process of curd making in <a href="https://www.news18.com/topics/samsung/">Samsung’s</a> Curd Maestro refrigerators has also been recommended by ICAR-National Dairy Research Institute, Karnal.</p>
<p id="2" class="story_para_2">The Samsung Curd Maestro refrigerator enables curd preparation in 6.5 to 7.5 hours — 6.5 hours for soft curd, 7.5 hours for thick curd. One needs to boil and cool the milk and mix the curd culture manually while Curd Maestro does the most crucial part of the job — fermentation. It will not only ferment the curd but will store it too.</p>
<p id="4" class="story_para_4">The 2022 range of Digi Touch Cool direct cool single door refrigerators will be available in new floral patterns – Urban Tropical and Hydrangea Pattern. The refrigerators are designed to offer more storage space and convenience, these refrigerators come with the patented Digi-Touch Cool 5-in-1 technology that allows users to control their refrigerator settings with a simple touch without opening the refrigerator door and help save energy by retaining cooling.</p>
<p id="5" class="story_para_5">The Samsung Digi Touch Cool is equipped with an advanced temperature control setting, users can easily control the temperature of their refrigerator based on varied seasonal conditions. Different levels of temperature points allow one to store their food optimally while meeting the changing season requirements.</p>
<p id="6" class="story_para_6">“The newly launched flower pattern for our Curd Maestro and Digi Touch Cool refrigerators are designed keeping in mind Indian consumers’ preferences. While our aim is to equip our consumers with the latest technology that makes their lives simpler, these exquisite designs on the refrigerators have been crafted to give an aesthetic touch to their overall home décor,” said Mohandeep Singh, Senior Vice President, Consumer Electronics Business, Samsung India. </p>
<p class="story_para_6"><img src="https://news.wrteam.in/public/images/news/1655705441.3077.jpg" alt="" width="1080" height="608"></p>
<p class="story_para_6">The Samsung Curd Maestro and Digi Touch Cool 2022 range of refrigerators will be available across all the retail channels and on Samsung’s official online store Samsung Shop. The <strong>Digi Touch</strong> Cool single door refrigerator range will start from <strong>Rs 18,690</strong> and Curd Maestro frost free range will start from <strong>Rs 27,990</strong>. Buyers can also get up to 15 percent cashback of up to Rs 8,500, easy EMI options starting at just Rs 990 per month, along with one EMI off on the new models.</p>

    description => string (1997) "<p id="0" class="story_para_0">Apple could finally ditch the lightning conne...
    $value[66]['description']
    <p id="0" class="story_para_0">Apple could finally ditch the lightning connector and offer a<span style="background-color: rgb(65, 245, 8);"><strong> USB Type C</strong><strong> port</strong></span> for charging with the iPhone 15 series. This projection has been made by analyst Ming-Chi Kuo on Wednesday, who has been accurate with his findings previously.</p>
<p id="1" class="story_para_1">Kuo says that according to his survey, Apple could switch to USB Type C for iPhones by the second half of 2023 when the iPhone 15 series will most likely be announced. He says that making this switch will help iPhones deliver faster-charging speeds and data transfer rates as well.</p>
<p id="3" class="story_para_3">But with a muted optimism, he adds that the final spec details will depend on iOS support for the standard charging port.</p>
<p id="4" class="story_para_4">Kuo’s update comes just a few days after the EU passed legislation that forces all manufacturers to adopt USB Type C charging ports for all mobile devices. Most Android phone makers and tablet producers have made the switch, but Apple is the last on the list which is yet to make the switch.</p>
<div class="nw18-dynamic-div-5155531_5_15"><img src="https://news.wrteam.in/public/images/news/1655704479.6465.jpg" alt="" width="1080" height="717"></div>
<p id="5" class="story_para_5">The new order could be mandated by the time the<span style="background-color: rgb(65, 245, 8);"><strong> iPhone 15 series is unveiled</strong></span>, so these updates from Kuo are not surprising.</p>
<p id="6" class="story_para_6">Apple switching to USB Type C could finally allow the iPhone maker to push through faster-charging speeds, something that has been deprived to iPhone users for many years now. Android phone makers have upped the levels by offering charging speeds up to 150W right now. So, it is high time that Apple joins the race and gives people more reasons to buy the iPhones, especially at those hefty prices.</p>

    description => string (1896) "<p id="0" class="story_para_0">Google Maps is a very good tool for finding y...
    $value[67]['description']
    <p id="0" class="story_para_0">Google Maps is a very good tool for finding your way and going places you have not explored so far. However, not many people know that you can actually get a street view of the International Space Station from Google Maps.</p>
<p id="1" class="story_para_1">Yes, Google Maps allows users to get a street view of the International Space Station (ISS), and the feature has been in place since 2017. To access it, however, you need a laptop or a computer, and go to a specific link. Users can see themselves on board the ISS, where they can explore all components of the space station, and get information at the same time. Users can tour the whole space station in 360, and can access information about components of the space station at hand on Google Maps’ street view of the ISS. </p>
<p id="2" class="story_para_2">To access ISS in Street View, users need to go the link google.com/maps/space/iss on Google Maps, and they will be thrown straight into the ISS viewing deck which is also called the Cupola navigation point. From there, users can enter the space station by clicking through. You will also see information about a certain part of the ISS as soon as you hover your mouse of click on anything.</p>
<div class="nw18-dynamic-div-5229421_4_7"> </div>
<p id="3" class="story_para_3">In a 2017 Blog Post, Thomas Pesquet, who is an Astronaut with the European Space Agency (ESA), said that the experience of capturing the tour “describes the feeling of being in space" better than words or a picture can." Pesquet, who helped Google collect the images from inside the space station, said that there were limitations to collecting the data. “In the six months that I spent on the International Space Station, it was difficult to find the words or take a picture that accurately describes the feeling of being in space," he said.</p>

    description => string (2271) "<p id="0" class="story_para_0">Instagram has a new plan to copy TikTok, and ...
    $value[68]['description']
    <p id="0" class="story_para_0">Instagram has a new plan to copy TikTok, and this time you are going to see all its videos and the feed in a full-screen mode. The platform has started testing out the new look and even updated the navigation bar. The updated design is available to select users for now, but Mark Zuckerberg, CEO, Meta confirmed via a post this week that others will be getting it soon as well.</p>
<p id="1" class="story_para_1">This is the official update shared by Instagram on Twitter, quoting Zuckerberg’s post.</p>
<p class="story_para_1"><img src="https://news.wrteam.in/public/images/news/1655536539.3158.jpg" alt="" width="1125" height="1985"></p>
<p class="story_para_1"> </p>
<p class="story_para_1">It is fair to say that Instagram is focusing on videos with its new approach and layout. “We want to make it easier to discover content and connect with friends,” Zuckerberg adds.</p>
<p id="4" class="story_para_4">But he is quick to clarify that even with videos as the main focus of the full-screen mode, Instagram will look to keep photos relevant on the platform. “Photos are still an important part of Instagram, and we’re working on ways to improve the way they show up in a full-screen Feed too,” has explained.</p>
<div class="nw18-dynamic-div-5391403_5_11"> </div>
<p id="5" class="story_para_5">As per the new layout, users will get to see videos in the full-screen mode, similar to how it looks on TikTok. The content changes as you scroll through the feed. Instagram says the description and other buttons used to like or comment on a video move to the bottom of the screen.</p>
<p id="6" class="story_para_6">The full-screen design shown by Zuckerberg in the post fits seamlessly on a bezel-less screen, but we are not sure how it will look for those with iPhones that has a notch.</p>
<p class="story_para_6">Instagram introduced Reels to take advantage of TikTok’s absence in multiple countries, including India. Reels has been a modest success for Meta, but TikTok and its growing presence in the West have overshadowed others in the business. With this new design change on the app, Meta and Zuckerberg will be hoping their fortunes with the platform also improve.</p>

    description => string (1873) "<p> </p> <p>Apple is planning to bring a new-look iPad to the market so...
    $value[69]['description']
    <p> </p>
<p>Apple is planning to bring a new-look iPad to the market soon which could support 5G network, powered by an <strong>A14 Bionic chipset,</strong> and also support USB Type C for charging. Apple has already updated the iPad Air lineup to these specifications, and now it is time for the company to overhaul the look and features of its entry-level iPad lineup.</p>
<p>The report does not share any concrete timeline for the launch, but an overhaul of the older iPad is long overdue. The regular iPad is selling for <span style="background-color: rgb(45, 194, 107);">around Rs 30,000</span> in the market, using the same old design and features has definitely helped Apple’s cause to keep its price down.</p>
<p>But with the market headed toward a future where <strong><em>USB Type C</em></strong> will the go-to standard for charging. All these changes could invariably increase the price of the entry-level iPad model as well.</p>
<p id="4" class="story_para_4">Apple is expected to offer this new iPad with a Retina display with the same resolution that you get on iPad Air. The existing iPad model sports an LCD screen, and the upgraded version could see a slight bump in the screen size as well.</p>
<p id="5" class="story_para_5">The other big change that one can expect is the use A14 Bionic chip to power this iPad, which is still pretty competent and powerful for most users. And using this chipset means you get software compatibility with the new iPadOS versions for many years to come.</p>
<p class="story_para_5">The M1 iPad Air was introduced in January this year, so it is likely that unless Apple wants to refresh the regular iPad this year itself, we will see the product around the same timeline. The change means Apple will have another product that goes higher up the price ladder and helps its business flourish even more.</p>

    ⇄⧉
    description => string (4260) "<p><strong>NEW YORK/WASHINGTON:</strong></p> <p>TikTok said it has completed...
    $value[70]['description']
    <p><strong>NEW YORK/WASHINGTON:</strong></p>
<p>TikTok said it has completed migrating information on its U.S. users to servers at Oracle Corp, in a move that could address U.S. regulatory concerns over data integrity on the popular short video app.</p>
<p>The move, which was first reported by Reuters, comes nearly two years after a U.S. national security panel ordered parent company ByteDance to divest TikTok because of fears that U.S. user data could be passed on to China's communist government.</p>
<p>TikTok is one of the world's most popular social media apps, with more than 1 billion active users globally, and counts the U.S. as its largest market.</p>
<p id="4" class="story_para_4">The United States has been increasingly scrutinizing app developers over the personal data they handle, especially if some of it involves U.S. military or intelligence personnel.</p>
<p id="5" class="story_para_5">The order to sell off TikTok was not enforced after Joe Biden succeeded Donald Trump as U.S. president last year.</p>
<p id="6" class="story_para_6">The panel, known as the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS), however, has continued to harbor concerns over data security at TikTok that ByteDance is now hoping to address, Reuters previously reported.</p>
<p id="7" class="story_para_7">The White House had no immediate comment while the U.S. Treasury declined to comment.</p>
<p id="8" class="story_para_8">In March, Reuters reported that TikTok was nearing a deal for Oracle Corp to store its U.S. users' information. [L2N2VD2GX]</p>
<p id="9" class="story_para_9">Oracle had discussed acquiring a minority stake in TikTok in 2020, when ByteDance was under U.S. pressure to sell the app. The cloud computing giant now stores all of TikTok's U.S. user data on Oracle data servers in the United States under the new partnership, TikTok said.</p>
<p id="10" class="story_para_10">Oracle declined to comment.</p>
<p id="11" class="story_para_11">DATA SECURITY TEAM</p>
<p id="12" class="story_para_12">TikTok had previously been storing its U.S. user data at its own data centers in Virginia, with a backup in Singapore. It will now delete private data on U.S. users from its own data centers and rely fully on Oracle's U.S. servers, it said.</p>
<p id="13" class="story_para_13">The Virginia and Singapore centers are still being used to back up the data, the company said.</p>
<p id="14" class="story_para_14">TikTok has also set up a dedicated U.S. data security team known as "USDS" as a gatekeeper for U.S. user information and ringfencing it from ByteDance, a company spokesperson told Reuters.</p>
<p id="15" class="story_para_15">Led by Andrew Bonillo, who was an executive at TikTok's global security department, the USDS currently reports to TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew, the spokesperson said.</p>
<p id="17" class="story_para_17">The company is discussing a structure under which the team would operate autonomously and not be under TikTok's control or supervision, a source told Reuters.</p>
<p id="18" class="story_para_18">Another senior executive at USDS is Will Farrell, who was previously working under TikTok's Chief Security Officer Roland Cloutier. The USDS team includes content moderation personnel, engineers, and members from user and product operations.</p>
<p id="19" class="story_para_19">ByteDance is one of China's fastest growing startups. It owns the country's leading news aggregator, Jinri Toutiao, as well as TikTok's Chinese counterpart Douyin.</p>
<div class="nw18-dynamic-div-5394901_19_25"> </div>
<p id="20" class="story_para_20">In June 2021, Biden withdrew Trump-era executive orders that sought to ban new downloads of WeChat and TikTok. The Commerce Department is writing new rules on app data security that could potentially lead to restrictions on how apps based abroad use U.S. user data or even ban apps deemed serious security risks.</p>
<p id="21" class="story_para_21">Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said last year the administration is "very serious about protecting Americans' data," but criticized Trump's approach.</p>
<p id="22" class="story_para_22">"Doing some executive order that's meaningless on TikTok is not the way to do it," she said.</p>

    description => string (2429) "<p>2022 is shaping up to be a big year at the Disneyland Resort, as the &lsq...
    $value[71]['description']
    <p>2022 is shaping up to be a big year at the Disneyland Resort, as the ‘Happiest Place on Earth’ continues its post-COVID comeback, with phased reintroductions of some of guests’ favorite park happenings.</p>
<p>In spring of 2022, celebrating its 50th anniversary year, the much-loved ‘Main Street Electrical Parade’ will illuminate the parade route running from the far side of Fantasyland down Main Street USA and, for all those who remember being mesmerized by its dazzling lights and catchy music as kids, the long-time favorite parade is as magical as ever. Guests can expect to see many of their electroluminescent favorites, such as Elliot the Dragon and floats featuring scenes from ‘Alice in Wonderland’, ‘Cinderella’ and ‘Peter Pan’.</p>
<p>Guests will also welcome the return of three completely captivating nighttime extravaganzas: ‘Fantasmic!’ and the ‘Disneyland Forever’ fireworks spectacular at Disneyland Park, an ‘World of Color’ over at Disney California Adventure.</p>
<p>On select dates in February 2022, the popular ‘Celebrate Gospel!’ event, a celebration of the soulful spirit of Gospel music, will also return to Disneyland Park. ‘Celebrate Gospel!’ will also be expanded next year, showcasing live choir performances, each with its own distinctive energy and style. For 2022, the inspiring event will move to Disneyland Park’s Fantasyland Theater, where guests will be able to enjoy a series of rousing gospel choir performances on select days.</p>
<p>The Disneyland Resort will once again be the place where friends and families meet to make memories together, for children (and, let’s face it, adults) to encounter their favorite Disney characters, and for connoisseurs of seasonal park fare and goodies to sink their teeth into some much-anticipated treats.</p>
<p>Limited-time festivals, previously put on hold because of the pandemic, will also start returning to the parks in spring of 2022, beginning with the Lunar New Year celebration, which commemorates various lunar new year traditions of Chinese, Korean and Vietnamese cultures. Next year’s edition will feature ‘Mulan's Lunar New Year Procession’, as well as a first appearance by Raya from Walt Disney Animation Studios' recent film ‘Raya and the Last Dragon’.</p>

    ⇄⧉
    description => string (3995) "<p>Travelers between the ages of 18 and 35 are springing back from the pande...
    $value[72]['description']
    <p>Travelers between the ages of 18 and 35 are springing back from the pandemic in big ways.</p>
<p>Over the past year and a half, when all travel was stalled, these travelers were the ones sharing their stories and their favorite destinations on social media, changing not just the destinations they’d like to visit, but also the trends and experiences they prefer.</p>
<p>Younger travelers, according to Contiki, desire either beach vacations, European explorations or something in between.</p>
<p>Immersion and adventure activities are top-of-mind for many travelers as they begin venturing back out into the world. The desire to experience more is going to be the impetus for many young travelers to visit places like Thailand, Ireland, Egypt and South Africa.</p>
<p>Solo travelers also make up almost half of the tour operator’s bookings for next year, signaling not only a confidence in traveling alone but a desire to experience the world from their own unique vantage points.</p>
<p>The average age of travelers booking with Contiki is 27, which makes sense considering that’s usually a time when working professionals are earning enough to begin going on trips before they’re obligated to pay for other expensive life milestones, like marriage, buying a house, or having a child.</p>
<p>Two millennial travel advisors weighed in on the trends they’ve been seeing among their younger travelers.</p>
<p>Ryan Doncsecz, Groups Department Manager at VIP Vacations and Jordan Bradshaw, Vice President at Northcutt Travel Agency, are both seeing similar trends emerge from their clients.</p>
<p>Popular destinations for younger clients from both agencies include Mexico and the Caribbean, especially when it comes to all-inclusives, as well as the ever-popular Walt Disney World and Disneyland parks. The main trend, though, is a focus towards more FIT journeys that focus on immersion and discovery.</p>
<p>“We have been seeing a big wave of younger travelers interested in seeing the world," said Doncsecz. "The first location in terms of ‘new booking requests’ that has surprised me a bit is the Maldives. While it has always been a bucket list destination for many, social media has helped share this unique locale with stunning beaches and hotels to the next generation of adventure seekers. This seems especially popular in the honeymoon market."</p>
<p>Bradshaw has seen similar interest in the Maldives and other tropical destinations that offer both beaches and adventure activities for honeymooners.</p>
<p>He also echoed the same trend in social media influencing younger clients: “We also see the younger generation of travelers is very influenced by what they see on social media and base their destinations that they ask about by 60-second clips they see on TikTok or Instagram. That is where I think a great travel agent can come in and advise more information about those destinations and if they think they would actually be a good fit for the client.”</p>
<p>Another trend they’ve been seeing is that younger travelers are oftentimes more willing to skimp on things like airfare in order to use their money in other, more rewarding ways for them. That also includes comparing travel advisors.</p>
<p>“A young traveler will still book the ‘basic economy’ flight to save $50 ahead of time, but then will whole-heartedly spend that $50 while away. As an advisor, it is important to recognize that you may be price shopped and often directly compared to another agency,” commented Doncsecz.</p>
<p>With plenty of younger travelers already fully vaccinated, travel fears are more about getting stuck in another country after testing positive than fears of safety while abroad.</p>
<p>Overall, younger travelers are looking for incredible escapes with opportunities for immersion and discovery, oftentimes influenced by social media and always within a particular budget.</p>

    description => string (2982) "<p>Holland America Line is celebrating the arrival of Wave Season with the l...
    $value[73]['description']
    <p>Holland America Line is celebrating the arrival of Wave Season with the launch of "The Ultimate Upgrade Event," which includes epic savings and free perks for travelers looking to sail an award-winning cruise line to the world's most sought-after destinations.</p>
<p>Now through February 28, 2022, guests who book a select summer 2022 through spring 2023 cruise will receive a free stateroom upgrade, $75 fares for kids on Alaska cruises and 50 percent reduced deposits on top of complimentary shore excursions, beverages, specialty dining and Wi-Fi with the "Have It All" premium package.</p>
<p>What's more, travelers who book by January 20, 2022, will also receive up to $200 per stateroom in onboard credit, depending on the length of their selected cruise. The Ultimate Upgrade Event fares start at just $799 per person, based on double occupancy, for Caribbean cruises and $849 for Alaska departures. However, those rates do not include taxes, fees and port expenses.</p>
<p>During The Ultimate Upgrade Event, guests can book an ocean view stateroom for the price of an interior, and a verandah stateroom for the price of an ocean view. And in honor of Holland America Line's upcoming 75th anniversary sailing in Alaska, kids ages 17 and under traveling as the third and fourth guests in a stateroom can sail on select Alaska cruises for as low as $75.</p>
<p>Depending on the cruise duration, Holland America Line guests can receive up to $200 in onboard credit per stateroom that they can put toward a variety of amenities, including specialty dining, spa services, shore excursions and gift shop purchases, among other things. Based on the length of the cruise, guests can receive up to three tours valued at $100 each.</p>
<p>When it comes to the Signature Beverage Package, guests can look forward to a large selection of wine, beer, spirits, cocktails, soda, water, coffee and more. The package includes up to 15 drinks per day and bar service charges. Plus, guests can indulge in Holland America Line's award-winning specialty dining for up to three nights, depending on the ship and the length of the cruise. Finally, guests will be treated to the Wi-Fi Surf Package, Holland America Line's most popular Wi-Fi package.</p>
<p>"By introducing our most enticing offer for the traditional ‘wave’ booking period, we want to encourage everyone to think about next year’s vacation plans now and book early," said Gus Antorcha, president of Holland America Line. "Cruising already is an unbeatable value, and when you add in our limited-time Ultimate Upgrade Event, there is no better time than now for our guests to plan their next cruise vacations to destinations around the world."</p>
<p>Keep in mind that The Ultimate Upgrade Event is not valid on Grand Voyages or cruises of five days or less. Plus, kids traveling as the third or fourth guest in a stateroom do not need to book with Have It All to receive $75 fares for Alaska cruises.</p>

    description => string (1425) "<p>Kongthong village is located in the East Khasi Hills district, which is 6...
    $value[74]['description']
    <p>Kongthong village is located in the East Khasi Hills district, which is 60 km from Meghalaya's capital city Shillong. The villagers here call each other with a unique tune.</p>
<p>The Ministry of Tourism has selected Meghalaya's Kongthong village, which is also known as the ‘whistling village’, for entry to UNWTO’s (The World Tourism Organisation) "Best Tourism Villages" award along with two other villages in the country.</p>
<p>Kongthong village is located in the East Khasi Hills district, which is 60 km from Meghalaya's capital city Shillong. People of this village have used whistling as a method of conveying their messages to their fellow villagers and that is why it is known as the ‘whistling village’.</p>
<p>The villagers here call each other with a unique tune. Each of them has a unique tune for calling each other and this tradition has been going on for generations.</p>
<p>The villagers have called this tune Jingrwai Lawbei which means mother's love song.</p>
<p>The villagers have two names - one is a regular name and another is a song name.</p>
<p>The song names are two versions - a long song and a short song and the short song is normally used at home.</p>
<p>Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma tweeted - "#Meghalaya's whistling village Kongthong is selected for entry to the @UNWTO 'Best Tourism Village' along with 2 other villages in the country."</p>

    description => string (3478) "<p>Thailand is still registering about 10,000 new cases a day -- largely fue...
    $value[75]['description']
    <p>Thailand is still registering about 10,000 new cases a day -- largely fuelled by the highly contagious Delta variant. It has more than 1.7 million cases to date and has recorded 17,751 dead.</p>
<p>Thailand plans to fully re-open to vaccinated tourists from countries deemed low risk from November 1, the country's leader said Monday, citing the urgent need to save the kingdom's ailing economy.</p>
<p>Before the pandemic, Thailand attracted nearly 40 million visitors a year drawn to its picturesque beaches and robust nightlife, with tourism making up almost 20 percent of its national income.</p>
<p>But Covid-related travel restrictions have left the economy battered, contributing to its worst performance in more than 20 years.</p>
<p>Premier Prayut Chan-O-Cha announced Monday the country will be reopening its borders to vaccinated tourists travelling by air from "low risk countries".</p>
<p>The 10 nations considered low risk include Britain, the United States, China, Germany and Singapore.</p>
<p>"When they arrive, they should present a (negative) Covid test... and test once again upon arrival," the prime minister said in a televised address.</p>
<p>After getting a negative test, "they can travel freely like Thais," he said.</p>
<p>His announcement significantly loosens up current restrictions in place for vaccinated tourists, who must undergo at least seven days hotel quarantine.</p>
<p>Thailand's so-called "sandbox" scheme in Phuket -- which allows vaccinated tourists to move freely around the popular beach island -- currently requires them to remain there for a week.</p>
<p>Visitors outside of Thailand's designated 10 low-risk countries are welcome, "but they have to be in quarantine," said Prayut, adding that more nations would be added to the greenlit list in December.</p>
<p>Earlier this year Prayut had vowed the country would reopen in October, stating its vaccination campaign would be sped up to reach 70 percent of the population.</p>
<p>To date, 48 percent of Thais nationwide have received at least a single vaccine dose, while more than 30 percent have double-jabbed, health officials said Monday.</p>
<p>The capital Bangkok -- once famed for its nightlife -- is still currently under a nighttime curfew, as well as a booze ban in bars and restaurants.</p>
<p>Prayut said Monday authorities will "consider allowing alcoholic drinks in restaurants and reopening entertainment venues under strict health measures" during the New Year's Eve period -- previously a money-maker for the kingdom's tourism sector.</p>
<p>He acknowledged his decision to reopen in less than a month came with the risk of more coronavirus cases.</p>
<p>"But I think the people will not be able to stand it if they have to lose a second chance at this business opportunity," the premier said, pointing to countries like Britain and Australia loosening their travel restrictions.</p>
<p>"The time has come for us to ready ourselves to face the coronavirus and live with it... much as we have learnt to live with other diseases with treatments and vaccinations," he said.</p>
<p>Last year, Thailand lost about $50 billion in tourism revenue as foreign arrivals plunged 83 percent to 6.7 million, from a record 39.9 million two years ago.</p>
<p>The kingdom is still registering about 10,000 new cases a day -- largely fuelled by the highly contagious Delta variant. It has more than 1.7 million cases to date and has recorded 17,751 dead.</p>

    description => string (2011) "<p>The screening featured the map of India, map of Telangana, Telangana Chie...
    $value[76]['description']
    <p>The screening featured the map of India, map of Telangana, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekhar Rao, Bathukamma flowers, with ‘Allipoola Vennela’ playing the background as the heritage of India and Telangana outshined at Burj Khalifa.</p>
<p>Telangana's traditional 'Bathukamma' (floral festival), celebrated by the womenfolk, was showcased on the world's largest screen on Burj Khalifa in Dubai.</p>
<p>TRS MLC K Kavitha-led cultural organisation 'Telangana Jagruthi', made arrangements to play the Bathukamma documentary on the big screen for invited delegates and separately for the local people on Saturday night, a release from Kavitha's office said here.</p>
<p>"Dubai's Burj Khalifa witnessed a unique show that celebrated Telangana's 'Bathukamma' on October 23. The show was live across various platforms around the globe," it said.</p>
<p>The screening featured the map of India, map of Telangana, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekhar Rao, Bathukamma flowers, with ‘Allipoola Vennela’ playing the background as the heritage of India and Telangana outshined at Burj Khalifa.<br />The slogans of Jai Hind, Jai Telangana, and Jai KCR on the Burj Khalifa screen echoed with tears of joy and pride among the viewers, it said.</p>
<p>The event was attended by Kavitha along with dignitaries from UAE and India, who witnessed the historical moment.</p>
<p>In October first week, Kavitha and filmmaker Gautham Vasudev Menon had launched a special Bathukamma song 'Mallipoola Vennela' composed by music maestro A R Rahman.</p>
<p>This year the nine-day long festival was celebrated from October 6 to 14.</p>
<p>Telangana Jagruthi, a cultural and literary organisation that was formed during the statehood movement for Telangana, has been working to preserve and celebrate the cultural heritage of Telangana, it said.</p>
<p>Led by Kavitha, Telangana Jagruthi has been working to empower the spirit of Telangana nationally as well as globally, the release added.</p>

    description => string (1389) "<p>The condition of many rivers in India recently do not meet the ideal desc...
    $value[77]['description']
    <p>The condition of many rivers in India recently do not meet the ideal description of pristine. It was not that long ago when the Yamuna river passing through Delhi NCR region made headlines for its pollution-induced toxic foam. However, one post shared by the official profile of Ministry of Jal Shakti has caught the attention of netizens. The post shows the picture a boat floating on a crystal clear river and netizens are stunned.</p>
<p>Shared on Twitter, the post shows a boat floating on the Umngot river flowing through Dawki lake in Meghalaya. The water of the river is squeaky clean as seen in the picture.</p>
<p>“One of the cleanest rivers in the world. It is in India. River Umngot, 100 Kms from Shillong, in Meghalaya state. It seems as if the boat is in the air and the water is so clean and transparent. Wish all our rivers were as clean. Hats off to the people of Meghalaya,” reads the caption.</p>
<p>The river flows into Bangladesh through Dawki and it also acts as a division between the Jaintia and Khasi Hills. Mawlynnyong, the village through which the river passes, is 78 km away from Shillong, the capital city of Meghalaya. Dawki has garnered tourists’ attention and has gained international fame over the years, all thanks to its crystal clear waters. There is a suspension bridge over the river for tourists to enjoy a panoramic view.</p>

    description => string (1645) "<p>If you love the mountains, we suggest you visit Chail. Himachal, in the w...
    $value[78]['description']
    <p>If you love the mountains, we suggest you visit Chail. Himachal, in the winters, is a separate feeling altogether. The crisp chill in the air, twists and turns of the hilly roads that appear less complicated than life altogether.</p>
<p>Far far away from the rat race in Delhi, I sat with a cup of masala tea in the balcony of a hotel in Chail, overlooking the Shivalik range. There was just one line that I could think of there is something about the mountains. The atmosphere actually forces you to pause and introspect even though life asks you to proceed otherwise. Nevertheless, I’d rather proceed with my experience at Treehouse Chail Villas rather than musing on philosophy, otherwise this article will never see the light of the day.</p>
<p>I visited Chail in November. Himachal, in the winters, is a separate feeling altogether. The crisp chill in the air, twists and turns of the hilly roads that appear less complicated than life altogether there I go again pine cones, waiting to be collected by tourists who have wanderlust in their blood, the works!</p>
<p>I stayed at Treehouse Chail Villas, located at a classic cut on a ruthless turn in the hilly road of the Shimla district’s Bhalawag village. Is Chail Villas actually a treehouse that you read about in Enid Blyton’s books? Read on for the answer.</p>
<p>Well, at the centre of the resort, lies a huge tree within a glass enclosure of sorts. “We aren’t allowed to cut trees here in Himachal. Hence, the tree was preserved and Chail Villas was built around it to give a treehouse-like effect,” Nitin Taneja, General Manager, says.</p>

    description => string (1751) "<p>Scientists have detected cases of a new variant of SARS-CoV-2, which is t...
    $value[79]['description']
    <p>Scientists have detected cases of a new variant of SARS-CoV-2, which is the virus that causes COVID-19, in a number of countries. Omicron (B.1.1.529) has an unprecedentedly large number of mutations in the part of its genome that encodes a key section of its spike protein, which the virus uses to infect host cells. This suggests that Omicron may be able to evade some of the immune protection afforded by vaccines, many of which are based on the original spike protein, and past infections.</p>
<p>On November 16, 2021, there were 136 daily recorded cases of COVID-19 in South Africa. By November 25, 2021, that number had risen to over 1,200.</p>
<p>More than 80% of these cases were in the densely populated province of Gauteng, which includes Johannesburg and Pretoria.</p>
<p>Researchers estimated that the R-value, which is the average number of new cases caused by each infection, was 1.47 for South Africa as a whole.</p>
<p>If R is more than 1, an outbreak will grow exponentially. In Gauteng province, R was 1.93.</p>
<p>Scientists at the Centre for Epidemic Response and Innovation (CERI) in Stellenbosch, South Africa, believe that a new variant of the virus known as Omicron (B.1.1.529) is responsible for these worrying figures.</p>
<p>There have been three previous peaks of infection in South Africa during the course of the pandemic, with the third due to the Delta variant. The latest surge coincides with the first detection of Omicron by scientists.</p>
<p>Scientists have sequenced around 100 confirmed cases of Omicron infection in South Africa. Most of the cases have been in Gauteng.</p>
<p>The new variant is also present in Botswana, Hong Kong, Europe, Canada, Israel, Japan, the United States, and elsewhere.</p>

    description => string (1746) "<p>England Test skipper Joe Root has admitted that he expected too much out ...
    $value[83]['description']
    <p>England Test skipper Joe Root has admitted that he expected too much out of all-rounder Ben Stokes in the first Ashes Test.</p>
<p>England Test skipper Joe Root has admitted that he expected too much out of all-rounder Ben Stokes in the first Ashes Test. England and Australia will lock horns in the second Test, beginning Thursday at Adelaide. Australia won the first Test by nine wickets to gain a 1-0 lead in the five-match series. "It was a huge ask and I'm probably as guilty as anyone; I expected too much of him. It's because I see him almost as a bit of a superhero. Look at what he's done in the last few years when he's played; at least once a series, maybe twice a series, he's done something extraordinary which has won us a game on its own. And you do get a little complacent about expecting that," ESPNcricinfo quoted Root as saying.</p>
<p>"It's easy to forget on a big occasion like that, whether it's because he's not played a huge amount and also what he's had to go through recently as well, I think there was a bit too much on him. But you know the character he is, it'll have motivated him even more now to put in one of those magical performances. Whether that comes this week or further down the series, I know it's going to come," he added.</p>
<p>Stokes scored 5 and 14 in his two innings at the Gabba in the first Test, and he also seemed to be hampered with a knee injury.</p>
<p>"I think the only thing I'd probably say - and it sounds ridiculous - is not to try too hard. They've not played the first game but they're world-class performers, they know what they're doing and should trust what they've done for so long. Just go and be Jimmy Anderson and Stuart Broad if you get your opportunity," said Root.</p>

    <p>Priyank Panchal was named as vice-captain Rohit Sharma's replacement in India squad for the Test series in South Africa.</p>
<p>Ahead of the South Africa tour, the Board for Control of Cricket in India (BCCI) on Monday announced that newly-appointed Test vice-captain Rohit Sharma will miss the Test series against Proteas due to a hamstring injury. Gujarat batter Priyank Panchal was named as Rohit Sharma's replacement in the India Test squad. Taking to Twitter, Panchal thanked everyone for all the "good wishes" and said that he was "honoured to be donning Team India jersey".</p>
<p>"Thank you everyone for all your good wishes. Honoured to be donning the team India jersey. Thank you for showing faith in me @BCCI Looking forward to the series!" Panchal wrote on Twitter.</p>
<p>"Exactly after 100 first-class matches and nearly after one and a half decade in domestic cricket, @PKpanchal9 has finally got a chance to prove himself in Test . Best wishes bhai," wrote India wicketkeeper batter Parthiv Patel while congratulating Panchal.</p>

    <p>Virat Kohli Press Conference Live Updates: Indian Test skipper Virat Kohli will address the media ahead of Team India's upcoming South Africa tour, scheduled to begin from December 26.</p>
<p>Virat Kohli Press Conference Live Updates: Indian Test skipper Virat Kohli is addressing the media ahead of Team India's upcoming South Africa tour, scheduled to begin from December 26. Kohli has clarified that he will be available for the three-match ODI series and had never asked for a break, contrary to media reports. The opening Test match will be played in Centurion at the SuperSport Park from December 26 to 30. Johannesburg's Wanderers Stadium will be the host to the second Test between January 3 to 7 next year. The third and final Test will be played in Newlands in Cape Town between January 11 to 15. Other than the Tests, India will also engage in a three-match ODI series while the T20I series was rescheduled for later.</p>

    description => string (1917) "<p> The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested another Afghan...
    $value[86]['description']
    <p> The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested another Afghan national in connection with the 3,000-kg heroin seizure by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) at Mundra port in Gujarat in September.</p>
<p>The accused has been identified as Sobhan Aryanfar (28). The agency arrested him from Neb Sarai in south Delhi.</p>
<p>According to the NIA, Aryanfar has been found to be involved in the conspiracy to transport narcotic drugs concealed in the import consignment of semi-processed talc stones, which had originated from Afghanistan.</p>
<p>The agency has registered the case under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act and the relevant provisions of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act and the Indian Penal Code, on the basis of the findings of the DRI.</p>
<p>The NIA officials suspect that the same network had been used to smuggle in another consignment in the past.</p>
<p>Some of the accused persons are said to be linked to a drug trafficking case registered earlier by the Special Cell of the Delhi Police.</p>
<p>Based on the inputs, the NIA had conducted searches in different parts of the country, including in and around Delhi, in October. It collected samples of suspected drugs from a warehouse.</p>
<p>Earlier, the DRI arrested 10 persons, including six Afghan nationals and an Uzbek woman, for their alleged involvement.</p>
<p>The DRI probe revealed that the contraband had been packed in Afghanistan and sent through Kandahar-based Hassan Hussain Limited. The consignment was declared as that of talc stones for export to Aashi Trading Company in Vijayawada, via Bandar Abbas port in Iran.</p>
<p>The drugs were meant to be brought to Delhi for further transportation and distribution.</p>
<p>The NIA will be contacting the authorities in Iran for gathering information about the persons who had booked the consignment at Bandar Abbas port.</p>

    description => string (1561) "<p>A man who travelled to Tamil Nadu from Nigeria and six of his family memb...
    $value[87]['description']
    <p>A man who travelled to Tamil Nadu from Nigeria and six of his family members, with COVID-19, have been admitted to the King Institute of Preventive Medicine in Chennai, Health Minister Ma. Subramanian said in Tiruchi on Tuesday. The man had landed at the Chennai International Airport two days ago from Nigeria via Doha. He was randomly subjected to the RT-PCR test. The 47-year-old patient was detected with the ‘S’ gene drop out, one of the early indicators of the Omicron variant.</p>
<p>Following this, his six other family members, were subjected to COVID-19 testing. They were also subsequently detected with the ‘S’ gene drop out. Since the preliminary analysis showed the possibility of the Omicron variant, they have been admitted to the King Institute. All of them are asymptomatic.They were under close surveillance, Mr. Subramanian told reporters after visiting the K.A.P. Viswanatham Medical College Hospital.</p>
<p>Mr. Subramanian said the samples had been sent to a laboratory in Bengaluru for genome sequencing tests. The results were expected on Tuesday evening or Wednesday. The State had so far sent samples of 29 other patients to Bengaluru to check for Omicron. Four of them had turned out to be cases of the Delta variant.</p>
<p>The Health Minister said that the State had 79 RT-PCR testing facilities. It had a capacity to screen 1.88 lakh patients a day. Twenty more RT-PCR machines had been procured for district headquarters hospitals and medical college hospitals to ramp up the testing facilities.</p>

    description => string (1797) "<p> Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said four more case...
    $value[88]['description']
    <p> Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said four more cases of the new COVID-19 variant, Omicron, have been detected in the national capital and all have travel history to foreign countries.</p>
<p>The Omicron variant of the coronavirus has not spread in the community so far and the situation is under control, he added.</p>
<p>Mr. Jain said the government is fully prepared to tackle the spread of any variant of the coronavirus.</p>
<p>"So far, six people have been found Omicron positive in the capital. One of them has been discharged. All of them had travelled to foreign countries and were transferred to the Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) hospital from the (Indira Gandhi International) airport," Mr. Jain told reporters.</p>
<p>So far, 74 travellers have been sent from the airport to the hospital, where a special ward has been set up for isolating and treating suspected cases of Omicron. Thirty-six of them have been discharged and 38 are admitted to the hospital.</p>
<p>Delhi's first patient of the Omicron variant —a 37-year-old man from Ranchi— was discharged from the LNJP hospital on Monday after he tested negative for COVID-19 twice, officials said.</p>
<p>The man had travelled from Tanzania to Doha and from there, to Delhi on a Qatar Airways flight on December 2. He stayed in Johannesburg in South Africa for a week and had mild symptoms.</p>
<p>The condition of the remaining five Omicron-positive patients is stable, Mr. Jain said.</p>
<p>Under new norms, RT-PCR tests are mandatory for the passengers arriving from the "at-risk" countries and they are allowed to leave the airport only after the results come.</p>
<p>Also, two per cent of the passengers arriving on flights from other countries are being tested randomly.</p>

    $value[89]['description']
    <p>On a day when the Special Investigation Team probing the Lakhimpur violence that claimed eight lives submitted that the entire incident was a “pre-planned conspiracy”, former Congress president Rahul Gandhi demanded the resignation of Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Mishra and sought an apology from Prime Minister Narendra Modi.</p>
<p>He alleged that the Minister tried to kill farmers and the Prime Minister knew as he was a member of his team.</p>
<p>“A Minister has tried to kill farmers. The Prime Minister knows as he is in his team. We raised the issue but we were not allowed a discussion on it even then. We were all silenced at the time after we wanted to discuss the issue,” Mr. Gandhi said. He was speaking at the conclusion of the joint Opposition march protesting against the suspension of 12 Rajya Sabha MPs.</p>
<p>Asked if the Congress would raise the issue in Parliament, the former Congress chief said, “We will certainly raise the issue in Parliament but they will not allow us to raise it.”</p>
<p>To another question, he said, “When they ran their jeep over farmers, which forces were behind them? Who gave them the liberty and which force kept them out of jail?” He alleged that there are two or three capitalists who want to steal the farmers’ income who are backing Mr. Modi. </p>

    description => string (1700) "<p>According to the reports, Ms. Nair, in her new position with the French l...
    $value[90]['description']
    <p>According to the reports, Ms. Nair, in her new position with the French luxury group Chanel, will be based in London.</p>
<p>Leena Nair, the first female and youngest-ever Chief Human Resources Officer of Anglo-Dutch FMCG major Unilever has stepped down to join French luxury group Chanel as its Global Chief Executive.</p>
<p>She was a member of the Unilever Leadership Executive (ULE), which is responsible for delivering Unilever’s business and financial performance.</p>
<p>“Leena Nair, CHRO, has decided to leave the company in January 2022 to pursue a new career opportunity as Global Chief Executive Officer, Chanel Ltd,” Unilever said in a statement while announcing change to its Leadership Executive.</p>
<p>According to the reports, Ms. Nair, in her new position with the French luxury group Chanel, will be based in London.</p>
<p>“I would like to thank Leena for her outstanding contribution over the last three decades. Leena has been a pioneer throughout her career at Unilever, but no more so than in her role as CHRO, where she has been a driving force on our equity, diversity and inclusion agenda, on the transformation of our leadership development, and on our preparedness for the future of work,” Unilever CEO Alan Jope said.</p>
<p>She has played a critical role in building our purpose-led, future-fit organisation, which is now the employer of choice in over 50 countries globally, he added.</p>
<p>Ms. Nair, an alumnus of XLRI Jamshedpur, had joined HUL, Unilever’s Indian subsidiary in 1992 and worked for 30 years.</p>
<p>Ms. Nair took to twitter to express her gratitude and recall her long association with the company.</p>

    description => string (1204) "<p>After Prime Minister Modi unveiled the Kashi Vishwanath Dham Corridor on ...
    $value[91]['description']
    <p>After Prime Minister Modi unveiled the Kashi Vishwanath Dham Corridor on Monday, chief ministers of 11 BJP-ruled states will visit Ayodhya today to offer prayers to Lord Ram.</p>
<p>The chief ministers are expected to reach Ayodhya by 11:30 am and will head to the Panchsheel Hotel from where they will arrive at Ram Ki Paidi around 12:10 pm.</p>
<p>Chief Ministers from Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Arunachal Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Assam, Nagaland, Manipur, Tripura, Gujarat, Haryana and Goa, and two deputy chief ministers from Bihar and one from Arunachal Pradesh will be visiting the holy city, the official said.</p>
<p>At the same time, BJP national president JP Nadda will land at the Ram Katha Park at 12 pm.</p>
<p>At Ram Ki Paidi, the chief ministers and their families will perform rituals.</p>
<p>Around 1 pm they will reach the Hanuman Garhi mandir and will proceed towards the construction site of the Ram Janmabhoomi temple and a ritual will be held at around 2 pm.</p>
<p>The chief ministers are in Varanasi, where they attended the inauguration of the Kashi Vishwanath Dham by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday. They also took part in a conclave of chief ministers.</p>

    description => string (1778) "<p>Senior citizens seeking work opportunities can now get a job from the SAC...
    $value[93]['description']
    <p>Senior citizens seeking work opportunities can now get a job from the SACRED employment exchange portal. </p>
<p>New Delhi: Starting from October 1, senior citizens seeking work opportunities will be able to bag jobs from the Indian government’s first-of-its-kind dedicated employment exchange.  </p>
<p>The portal known as Senior Able Citizens for Re-Employment in Dignity (SACRED) will help Indians above 60 years of age to find jobs easily, right at the comfort of their homes. The portal is operated by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment (MoSJ&E’s) </p>
<p>In a statement, the ministry said that any job provider - individual, firm, company, partnership, and voluntary organisation - can also register on the portal. “The job provider will specify the task involved and the number of senior citizens that are required to complete it," the ministry said.</p>
<p>The ministry will spend Rs 10 crore to fund the platform development while a maintenance grant of Rs 2 crore has been approved as well. Moreover, additional Rs 10 crore will be spent annually for the publicity of the portal so that more people know about the initiative. </p>
<p>For registration purposes, senior citizens will have to share their relevant education, past experience, skills and areas of interest. The ministry pointed out that the individuals on the platform can also add select keywords related to their expected job roles, which will enable job providers to find them automatically.</p>
<p>"Therefore, the Employment Portal will serve not only the senior citizens seeking employment, but also the employers, the Self Help Groups (SHGs), the senior citizens gaining skills, and other agencies or individuals," the ministry said.</p>

    <p>LONDON: <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/Ole-Gunnar-Solskjaer" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_Ole-Gunnar-Solskjaer">Ole Gunnar Solskjaer</a> admits <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/Manchester-United" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_Manchester-United">Manchester United</a>'s new signings have heightened trophy expectations after Gary Neville suggested the Norwegian was running out of time to deliver silverware. <br />United are still searching for their first trophy since Solskjaer took charge in 2018.</p>
<div id="v-timesofindia-indiatimes-0" style="display: block; width: 100%; margin-left: 0px;"> </div>
<p><br />They finished second in the <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/premier-league" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_premier-league">Premier League</a> last season and lost the Europa League final against Villarreal, who visit <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/Old-Trafford" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_Old-Trafford">Old Trafford</a> in the Champions League on Wednesday. <br />Neville added to the pressure on his former United team-mate when he said Solskjaer needs to win trophies within 12 to 18 months because of the backing he has enjoyed in the transfer market. </p>
<div id="div-gpt-ad-1416990040345-7-86588737-1" class="outstreamad" style="width: auto; height: auto;" data-videoarticle="0" data-google-query-id="CIetwpW3qPMCFaMC1Qod3J0HZA">
<div id="google_ads_iframe_/7176/TOI/TOI_ROS/TOI_ROS_Out_1x1_0__container__" style="border: 0pt none;"><iframe id="google_ads_iframe_/7176/TOI/TOI_ROS/TOI_ROS_Out_1x1_0" style="border: 0px none; vertical-align: bottom;" title="3rd party ad content" name="google_ads_iframe_/7176/TOI/TOI_ROS/TOI_ROS_Out_1x1_0" width="1" height="1" frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0" scrolling="no" data-google-container-id="8" data-load-complete="true" data-mce-fragment="1"></iframe></div>
</div>
<p>Five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo, England winger <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/Jadon-Sancho" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_Jadon-Sancho">Jadon Sancho</a> and France defender <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/Raphael-Varane" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_Raphael-Varane">Raphael Varane</a> joined United in the last transfer window, with Bruno Fernandes and Edinson Cavani arriving in 2020. <br />But United exited the League Cup earlier this month and are bottom of their Champions League group after conceding a stoppage-time winner at Young Boys in the opening game. <br />"That pressure is a privilege. To work in this environment, you have to embrace that pressure," Solskjaer told reporters on Tuesday. <br />"Yes, I have been backed. The progress and process has worked well. But we're in a results business. <br />"We've improved, expectations have improved with the signings and better performances. <br />"I'm here to win and Gary knows that. He's always got loads to say! <br />"I'm used to Gary. He's always said a lot, when I was sat next to him as well in the dressing-room." <br />Neville also called Solskjaer's team an "odd bunch" due to a tendency to win games through moments of individual brilliance rather than collective performances. <br />United lost 1-0 to Aston Villa in the Premier League on Saturday, missing the chance to go top of the table and making it three defeats in their last four games in all competitions.</p>

    description => string (2085) "<p>MADRID: <a class="" href="https://www.happytrips.com/topic/Barcelona" rel...
    $value[95]['description']
    <p>MADRID: <a class="" href="https://www.happytrips.com/topic/Barcelona" rel="noopener nofollow noreferrer" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_https://www.happytrips.com/topic/Barcelona">Barcelona</a>'s 17-year-old midfielder has been handed a surprise call up by <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/Spain" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_Spain">Spain</a> coach <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/Luis-Enrique" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_Luis-Enrique">Luis Enrique</a> for the <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/Nations-League-Final" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_Nations-League-Final">Nations League Final</a> Four tournament in Italy next month. <br />Gavi, who has only featured for Spain at junior levels previously and turned 17 in August, has made just two LaLiga starts for the Catalans this term. However, he has done enough across his six appearances in all competitions to impress Luis Enrique and earn a spot in the 23-man squad. <br />Villarreal's 18-year-old forward Yeremy Pino is another uncapped name included by Luis Enrique, who is without regulars Alvaro Morata, Gerard Moreno, Thiago Alcantara and Sergio Ramos through injury. <br />The two teenagers are joined by fellow Barca youngsters Pedri, who has recovered from a thigh injury, and Eric Garcia in a squad that includes four from the Camp Nou side despite their poor start to the season. </p>
<div id="div-gpt-ad-1416990040345-7-86644073-1" class="outstreamad" data-videoarticle="0"> </div>
<p>Once again there are no Real Madrid players included despite them being top of LaLiga. <br />Elsewhere, Chelsea's Marcos Alonso's fine start to the season has been rewarded with a recall and he is in line to add to his three caps which all came in 2018. <br />Atletico Madrid utility man Marcos Llorente is included as a forward despite usually playing full-back for his country, while David de Gea will be hoping his stellar start to the campaign will earn him a spot in the XI once again.</p>

    <p>SHARJAH: <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl/top-stories/ipl-auction-2018-complete-squad-of-sunrisers-hyderabad/articleshow/62684939.cms" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl/top-stories/ipl-auction-2018-complete-squad-of-sunrisers-hyderabad/articleshow/62684939.cms">Sunrisers Hyderabad</a> (<a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl/top-stories/ipl-auction-2018-complete-squad-of-sunrisers-hyderabad/articleshow/62684939.cms" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl/top-stories/ipl-auction-2018-complete-squad-of-sunrisers-hyderabad/articleshow/62684939.cms">SRH</a>) skipper <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/Kane-Williamson" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_Kane-Williamson">Kane Williamson</a> admitted the side didn't put on a fighting total against <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl/top-stories/ipl-2018-complete-ipl-squad-of-chennai-super-kings/articleshow/62684882.cms" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl/top-stories/ipl-2018-complete-ipl-squad-of-chennai-super-kings/articleshow/62684882.cms">Chennai Super Kings</a> (CSK) on Thursday. <br />CSK defeated SRH by six wickets despite a late wobble in the <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl">Indian Premier League</a> (<a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl">IPL</a>) encounter here at the Sharjah <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket">Cricket</a> Stadium. <br />SRH were only able to score 134 in the allotted 20 overs and Williamson cited this as one of the reasons for the loss. <br />"Not quite enough runs. It wasn't an easy surface and although we didn't get enough we showed a fighting spirit in the last quarter with the ball. We need 10-15 extra runs with the bat though and we need to make those small," said Williamson during the post-match presentation.</p>
<p>"After the powerplay we were 40-something and although you feel like you want more, it was a good start on that surface. You want to score a few more runs though, but we saw some nice contributions from the lower order. We need to improve. This team is at the top of the table," he added. <br />CSK was the first team to get knocked out in IPL 2020 and on Thursday the Dhoni-led side became the first team to qualify for the playoffs after defeating SRH by six wickets. <br />"If you make better decisions with the bat, the final score could have been a little more. CSK played really well. It looked challenging and variable. We are back to the drawing board," said Williamson. <br />"Although every match is about the W or the L against your name, you do look at the growth of the team. This season has been a bit disjointed given that it was played in two halves, but we'll look to grow and build some momentum," he added. <br />SRH have been knocked out of the <a class="" href="https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl" data-ga="within_article-topic_link|topic_https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/ipl">IPL 2021</a>, the side will next face Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Sunday.</p>

    description => string (1443) "<h3>Meril has got ICMR approval for its self-use rapid antigen test for Covi...
    $value[97]['description']
    <h3>Meril has got ICMR approval for its self-use rapid antigen test for Covid-19, CoviFind. The test delivers results in 15 minutes, Meril said in a statement.</h3>
<p>Medtech firm Meril has said it has received approval from the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) for its self-use rapid antigen test kit for Covid-19.</p>
<p>Meril’s indigenous home-use rapid antigen test kits “CoviFind” will expand access to Covid-19 testing, while also helping the nation meet the demand for increased and frequent screening to curb the spread of the pandemic, Meril said in a statement.</p>
<p>The test delivers results swiftly, providing accurate results in 15 minutes, it added.</p>
<p>“By making reliable rapid antigen testing available to all through a convenient format, Meril''s CoviFind test will facilitate early detection, isolation, treatment and contact tracing," Meril Senior Vice-President (Corporate Strategy) Sanjeev Bhatt said.</p>
<p>Meril said it has supplied a large number of tests across its Covid-19 diagnostics offerings across India, which include a multiplex RT-PCR test, Kavach antibody tests in partnership with ICMR.</p>
<h3><strong>What will the test include?</strong></h3>
<p>The test kit is equipped with testing materials including a test device, one sterile nasal swab and a pre-filled buffer tube with a cap and is priced at Rs 250 as an affordable single-pack, the company said.</p>

    description => string (2150) "<h4>Insigne and Immobile scored after Demiral's own goal as Italy beat Turke...
    $value[98]['description']
    <h4>Insigne and Immobile scored after Demiral's own goal as Italy beat Turkey 3-0 in the opening game of the Euro 2020, which is being held after a year's delay due to the Covid-19 pandemic.</h4>
<div class="briefcase">
<h2>HIGHLIGHTS</h2>
<ul>
<li>Italy beat Turkey 3-0 thanks to goals from Insigne and Immobile after Delmirah's mistake</li>
<li>This is the 1st time Italy have scored thrice in the European Championship history</li>
<li>Italy stretched their unbeaten run to 28 games and managed their 9th successive clean sheet</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="story-movie">
<div class="movie-detail"> </div>
</div>
<div class="description ">
<p>Italy made history in Rome on Saturday night as they registered a crushing 3-0 win over Turkey at the Stadio Olimpico to clinch 3 crucial points in the opening match of the Euro 2020.</p>
<p>Italy dominated from the start but was denied in the first half by a superb save from Çakr and a decision by the referee not to award a penalty for an apparent handball. Such was the pressure created by Italy that they took 13 shots in the first half itself but just 3 were on target.</p>
<p>The deadlock was finally broken in the 53rd minute when Merih Demiral couldn't block a shot from the Italian striker Berardi and the ball went into the back of the net after taking a deflection.</p>
<p>Immobile and Insigne then added to Turkey's woes as they scored once each in the 66th and 79th minutes to take the game away from their opponents.</p>
<p>This is the first time in Euro history that Italy have scored three goals in a match and stretched their unbeaten run to 28 games. This is also their 9th successive clean sheet and the biggest margin of victory in the opening match of a European Championship tournament ever.</p>
<p>The Stadio Olimpico was still only 25% full because of coronavirus measures and fans sat in small groups safely distanced from one another. Still, the crowd of about 16,000 was the largest gathering in Italy since the pandemic took hold.</p>
<p>Wales and Switzerland, the other teams in Group A, will play in Baku, Azerbaijan, on Saturday.</p>
</div>

    description => string (2484) "<p class="summary">The PMO said in a statement on Monday that the services o...
    $value[99]['description']
    <p class="summary">The PMO said in a statement on Monday that the services of final year MBBS students can also be utilised for providing services like tele-consultation and monitoring of mild COVID cases after due orientation under the faculty's supervision.</p>
<p class="summary">Seeking to augment human resources deployed in fighting <a href="https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/tag/covid-19">COVID-19</a>, Prime Minister <a href="https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/tag/narendra+modi">Narendra Modi</a> has approved a number of measures, including postponing the NEET-PG for at least four months to make a large number of qualified doctors available for <a href="https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/tag/pandemic">pandemic</a> duty and pressing into service medical interns.<br /><br />The <a href="https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/tag/pmo">PMO</a> said in a statement on Monday that the services of final year MBBS students can also be utilised for providing services like tele-consultation and monitoring of mild <a href="https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/tag/covid">COVID</a> cases after due orientation under the faculty's supervision.<br /><br />Medical interns will work under the supervision of their faculty.</p>
<p class="summary">This will reduce the workload on the existing doctors engaged in COVID duty and boost the efforts of triaging, it said.<br /><br />It added that B.Sc. or GNM qualified nurses may be utilised in full-time COVID nursing duties under the supervision of senior doctors and nurses.<br /><br />Those providing services in COVID management will be given priority in forthcoming regular government recruitments after they complete a minimum of 100 days of duty, the PMO said.<br /><br />The medical students and professionals to be engaged in COVID related work will be suitably vaccinated, it said.<br /><br />All such professionals who sign up for minimum 100 days of duty and complete it successfully will also be given the Prime Minister's Distinguished COVID National Service Samman from the government of India.<br /><br />They will also be covered under the government's insurance scheme for health workers engaged in fighting COVID-19.</p>
<p class="summary">The statement said the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test for Post-Graduation (NEET-PG) will be postponed for at least four months, and the exam will not be held before August 31.</p>

    description => string (3293) "<p>"The news reports suggest that the last order placed with the two vaccine...
    $value[100]['description']
    <p>"The news reports suggest that the last order placed with the two vaccine makers (100 million doses with SII and 20 million doses with Bharat Biotech) was in March 2021. These media reports are completely incorrect, and are not based on facts," the ministry said in a statement.</p>
<p>New Delhi: The <a href="https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/tag/union+health+ministry">union health ministry</a> on Monday said that media reports alleging that the Centre has not placed any fresh order for <a href="https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/tag/covid-19+vaccines">COVID-19 vaccines</a> are "incorrect" and are not based on facts.<br /><br />"The news reports suggest that the last order placed with the two vaccine makers (100 million doses with SII and 20 million doses with Bharat Biotech) was in March 2021. These media reports are completely incorrect, and are not based on facts," the ministry said in a statement.<br /><br />The ministry further said that against the last order of 10 crore doses for supplies of Covishield vaccine, 8.744 crore doses have been delivered till May 3.<br /><br /></p>
<div id="in-page-promotions_in_page_1_82370843" class="in-page-promotions-buckets-featured featured_section_disabled  bucket-position-in_page" data-bucket-limit="1" data-bucket-id="2" data-bucket-design="3" data-bucket-position="in_page" data-type="in-page-promotions" data-ftd-params="design=3&limit=1&entity_type=all&position=in_page&bucket_id=2&rendered_items=0&" data-ftd-type="in-page-promotions" data-ftd-callback="inPagePromoCallback"> </div>
<p>"It is clarified that 100 per cent advance of Rs 1732.50 crore (after TDS Rs 1699.50 crore) was released to <a href="https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/tag/serum+institute+of+india">Serum Institute of India</a> (SII) on April 28 for 11 crore doses of Covishield vaccine during May, June and July, and was received by them on April 28," it said.<br /><br />Additionally, 100 per cent advance of Rs 787.50 crore (after TDS Rs 772.50 crore) was released on April 28 to Bharat Biotech India Ltd (BBIL) for five crore Covaxin doses during May, June and July, and was received by them on April 28.<br /><br />It further said that as on date against the last order of 2 crore doses for supplies of Covaxin vaccine, 0.8813 crore doses have been delivered till May 3.<br /><br />"Hence to say that fresh orders have not been placed by the government is not correct."<br /><br />"As of 2nd May 2021, <a href="https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/tag/government+of+india">Government of India</a> has provided more 16.54 crore vaccine doses to States/UTs Free of Cost. More than 78 lakh doses are still available with the states and UTs to be administered. More than 56 Lakh doses, in addition, will be received by the states and UTs in the next three days," it further said.<br /><br />The ministry said that under the Liberalised Pricing and Accelerated National COVID-19 Vaccination Strategy, the government would continue to procure its share of 50 per cent of the monthly Central Drugs Laboratory (CDL) cleared vaccines and would continue to make them available to the state governments totally free of cost as was being done earlier.</p>

<div class="para-live-blog" data-id="0">
<div>
<p>11:35 IST: That is it from the Test series! Sri Lanka have won their first series of 2021 and have unearthed a gem in young Praveen Jayawickrama. Bangladesh have succumbed yet again in the longest form. Mominul Haque will hope that his side can improve and finally take that next step in the red-ball form. Hope you enjoyed the coverage. We hope to see you soon. Till then, goodbye and take care!</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="para-live-blog" data-id="1">
<div>
<p>11:29 IST: For his fantaastic performance with the bat in both the Tests in this series, Sri Lankan skipper, Dimuth Karunaratne is named the Player of the Series. Karunaratne says they are playing well and tells he needed to deliver as captain as he was short of runs coming into the series. Credits the bowlers for the way they bowled. Karunaratne says he was too positive from the first ball against West Indies. Tells he spoke to the coaches about it and was told to respect the bowlers and the good ball and that is what he tried to do. Karunaratne says they have faith they can win games and tells they needed to put score on the board. Karunaratne says everything went well in this Test from the go. Credits Praveen says he was fantastic along with Ramesh Mendis and tells once they get more confidence from playing, they will be able to fill the shoes of Rangana Herath. </p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="para-live-blog" data-id="2">
<div>
<p>11:28 IST: Bangladesh skipper, Mominul Haque, says that the toss was the most important thing in his view. He believes there was nothing on the first two days for the bowlers and hence he feels the toss was crucial. Mominul says the conditions were very similar to home. Mominul says while playing international cricket there will be pressure and one should embrace it. Mominul feels they lost the game in the first innings as they failed to put up score with the bat in the first innings.</p>
</div>
</div>

    description => string (1276) "<p>Mask protects against SARS-CoV-2, the coronavirus that causes Covid-19. V...
    $value[104]['description']
    <p>Mask protects against SARS-CoV-2, the coronavirus that causes Covid-19. Vaccine protects against severity of Covid-19. And, oxygen gives extra hours and days to patients for medicines to alleviate symptoms. The oxygen that a Covid-19 patient requires is medical oxygen.</p>
<p>Medical oxygen is produced in specialised manufacturing units as industrial oxygen and purified over 93 per cent for the use of patients suffering from oxygen starvation. In the cases of Covid-19, severely ill patients need oxygen support as they fail to utilise environmental oxygen in their respiration.</p>
<p>Oxygen need of Covid-19 patients vary depending on the severity of their illness. On an average, less than 10 per cent Covid-19 patients need oxygen support. Fewer number of Covid-19 patients require usage of high flow nasal cannula (HFNC).</p>
<p><strong>WHY COVID-19 PATIENT NEED OXYGEN SUPPLY?</strong></p>
<p>An average adult person inhales and exhales about seven to eight litres of air while resting in a minute. This is about 11,000 litres of air per day. Inhaled air contains 21 per cent oxygen (environmental composition) and exhaled air contains about 15 per cent oxygen. The difference is absorbed by the lungs. If there is a shortage, it needs to be supplemented.</p>

    description => string (1470) "<div>Dubai, Mar 24 (PTI) India captain Virat Kohli moved up a place to fourt...
    $value[105]['description']
    <div>Dubai, Mar 24 (PTI) India captain Virat Kohli moved up a place to fourth in the ICC T20 rankings for batsmen, while his deputy Rohit Sharma climbed three spots to 14th in the latest list issued on Wednesday.
<p>Kohli, who slammed an unbeaten 80 off 52 balls coming in as an opener in the series against England, is now the highest ranked from India ahead of K L Rahul.</p>
<p>Rohit''s 34-ball 64 in that match has helped him move up three places to 14th in the weekly update which took into account the three-match Afghanistan-Zimbabwe series in Abu Dhabi apart from the last two matches of the India-England series, the ICC stated.</p>
<p>In other gains for India''s batsmen, Shreyas Iyer has moved up five places to a career-best 26th position while rookie Suryakumar Yadav and wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant too have made rapid progress.</p>
<p>Yadav, who debuted in the second match of the series but could not garner any points as he did not get to bat, has pushed up from the bottom to 66th position after scores of 57 and 32 while Pant has moved up 11 places to 69th in the rankings.</p>
<p>Seam bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar, player of the match in the last game for his spell of two for 15, has moved up 21 places to 24th while Hardik Pandya has advanced 47 places to 78th.</p>
<p>For England, Dawid Malan maintains a healthy lead at the top of the rankings after his 68 in the final match while Jos Buttler has inched up one place to 18th.</p>
</div>

    description => UTF-8 string (1202) "<p><strong class="place_cont">New Delhi: </strong>In the first reduction in ...
    $value[106]['description']
    <p><strong class="place_cont">New Delhi: </strong>In the first reduction in rates in over a year, petrol price today was cut by 18 paise per litre and diesel by 17 paise a litre as international oil prices tumbled to the lowest since early February.</p>
<p>Petrol price was cut to ₹ 90.99 a litre in Delhi from ₹ 91.17 per litre, according to a price notification of state-owned fuel retailers.</p>
<p>Diesel now comes for ₹ 81.30 a litre in the national capital, down from ₹ 81.47 previously.</p>
<p>Rates have been reduced across the country and vary from state to state depending on the local incidence of taxation (VAT).</p>
<p>This is the first reduction in fuel prices in over a year. Prices were last reduced on March 16, 2020.</p>
<p>Despite bouts of rate freeze, prices had gone up by a record ₹ 21.58 per litre on petrol in the last one year. On diesel prices had increased by ₹ 19.18 a litre.</p>
<p>Prices which last month hit record highs including crossing ₹ 100 mark in some places in Rajasthan, Maharasthra and Madhya Pradesh, had been on freeze since February-end when elections to five states including West Bengal, Assam, Tamil Nadu and Kerala were announced.</p>
